Questions: A relational database consists of a collection of
Explanation: Fields are the column of the relation or tables. Records are each row in a relation. Keys are the constraints in a relation.

Questions: A ________ in a table represents a relationship among a set of values.
Explanation: Column has only one set of values. Keys are constraints and row is one whole set of attributes. Entry is just a piece of data.

Questions: The term _______ is used to refer to a row.
Explanation: Tuple is one entry of the relation with several attributes which are fields.

Questions: The term attribute refers to a ___________ of a table.
Explanation: Attribute is a specific domain in the relation which has entries of all tuples.

Questions: For each attribute of a relation, there is a set of permitted values, called the ________ of that attribute.
Explanation: The values of the attribute should be present in the domain. Domain is a set of values permitted.

Questions: Database __________ which is the logical design of the database, and the database _______ which is a snapshot of the data in the database at a given instant in time.
Explanation: Instance is an instance of time and schema is a representation.

Questions: Course(course_id,sec_id,semester) Here the course_id,sec_id and semester are __________ and course is a _________
Explanation: The relation course has a set of attributes course_id,sec_id,semester .

Questions: Department (dept name, building, budget) and Employee (employee_id, name, dept name, salary) Here the dept_name attribute appears in both the relations. Here using common attributes in relation schema is one way of relating ___________ relations.
Explanation: Here the relations are connected by the common attributes.

Questions: A domain is atomic if elements of the domain are considered to be ____________ units.
Explanation: None.

Questions: The tuples of the relations can be of ________ order.
Explanation: The values only count. The order of the tuples does not matter.

Questions: Which one of the following is a set of one or more attributes taken collectively to uniquely identify a record?
Explanation: Super key is the superset of all the keys in a relation.

Questions: Consider attributes ID, CITY and NAME. Which one of this can be considered as a super key?
Explanation: Here the id is the only attribute which can be taken as a key. Other attributes are not uniquely identified.

Questions: The subset of a super key is a candidate key under what condition?
A: No proper subset is a super key
D: Each subset is a super key
Explanation: The subset of a set cannot be the same set. Candidate key is a set from a super key which cannot be the whole of the super set.

Questions: A _____ is a property of the entire relation, rather than of the individual tuples in which each tuple is unique.
Explanation: Key is the constraint which specifies uniqueness.

Questions: Which one of the following attribute can be taken as a primary key?
Explanation: The attributes name, street and department can repeat for some tuples. But the id attribute has to be unique. So it forms a primary key.

Questions: Which one of the following cannot be taken as a primary key?
Explanation: Street is the only attribute which can occur more than once.

Questions: An attribute in a relation is a foreign key if the _______ key from one relation is used as an attribute in that relation.
Explanation: The primary key has to be referred in the other relation to form a foreign key in that relation.

Questions: The relation with the attribute which is the primary key is referenced in another relation. The relation which has the attribute as a primary key is called
Explanation: None.

Questions: The ______ is the one in which the primary key of one relation is used as a normal attribute in another relation.
Explanation: None.

Questions: A _________ integrity constraint requires that the values appearing in specified attributes of any tuple in the referencing relation also appear in specified attributes of at least one tuple in the referenced relation.
Explanation: A relation, say r1, may include among its attributes the primary key of another relation, say r2. This attribute is called a foreign key from r1, referencing r2. The relation r1 is also called the referencing relation of the foreign key dependency, and r2 is called the referenced relation of the foreign key.

Questions: Using which language can a user request information from a database?
Explanation: Query language is a method through which the database entries can be accessed.

Questions: Student(ID, name, dept name, tot_cred)In this query which attributes form the primary key?
Explanation: The attributes name, dept and tot_cred can have same values unlike ID.

Questions: Which one of the following is a procedural language?
Explanation: Domain and Tuple relational calculus are non-procedural language. Query language is a method through which database entries can be accessed.

Questions: The_____ operation allows the combining of two relations by merging pairs of tuples, one from each relation, into a single tuple.
Explanation: Join finds the common tuple in the relations and combines it.

Questions: The result which operation contains all pairs of tuples from the two relations, regardless of whether their attribute values match.
Explanation: Cartesian product is the multiplication of all the values in the attributes.

Questions: The _______operation performs a set union of two “similarly structured” tables
Explanation: Union just combines all the values of relations of same attributes.

Questions: The most commonly used operation in relational algebra for projecting a set of tuple from a relation is
Explanation: Select is used to view the tuples of the relation with or without some constraints.

Questions: The _______ operator takes the results of two queries and returns only rows that appear in both result sets.
Explanation: The union operator gives the result which is the union of two queries and difference is the one where query which is not a part of second query.

Questions: A ________ is a pictorial depiction of the schema of a database that shows the relations in the database, their attributes, and primary keys and foreign keys.
Explanation: None.

Questions: The _________ provides a set of operations that take one or more relations as input and return a relation as an output.
Explanation: None.

Questions: Which one of the following is used to define the structure of the relation, deleting relations and relating schemas?
Explanation: Data Definition language is the language which performs all the operation in defining structure of relation.

Questions: Which one of the following provides the ability to query information from the database and to insert tuples into, delete tuples from, and modify tuples in the database?
Explanation: DML performs the change in the values of the relation.

Questions: CREATE TABLE employee (name VARCHAR, id INTEGER) What type of statement is this?
Explanation: Data Definition language is the language which performs all the operation in defining structure of relation.

Questions: SELECT * FROM employee What type of statement is this?
Explanation: Select operation just shows the required fields of the relation. So it forms a DML.

Questions: The basic data type char(n) is a _____ length character string and varchar(n) is _____ length character.
Explanation: Varchar changes its length accordingly whereas char has a specific length which has to be filled by either letters or spaces.

Questions: An attribute A of datatype varchar(20) has the value “Avi”. The attribute B of datatype char(20) has value ”Reed”. Here attribute A has ____ spaces and attribute B has ____ spaces.
Explanation: Varchar changes its length accordingly whereas char has a specific length which has to be filled by either letters or spaces.

Questions: To remove a relation from an SQL database, we use the ______ command.
Explanation: Drop table deletes the whole structure of the relation .purge removes the table which cannot be obtained again.

Questions: DELETE FROM r;   //r - relation    This command performs which of the following action?
Explanation: Delete command removes the entries in the table.

Questions: INSERT INTO instructor VALUES (10211, ’Smith’, ’Biology’, 66000);   What type of statement is this?
Explanation: The values are manipulated. So it is a DML.

Questions: Updates that violate __________ are disallowed.
Explanation: Integrity constraint has to be maintained in the entries of the relation.

Questions: Name :Annie  Bob  Callie  Derek      Which of these query will display the the table given above ?
Explanation: The field to be displayed is included in select and the table is included in the from clause.

Questions: Here which of the following displays the unique values of the column?     SELECT ________ dept_name        FROM instructor;
Explanation: Distinct keyword selects only the entries that are unique.

Questions: The ______ clause allows us to select only those rows in the result relation of the ____ clause that satisfy a specified predicate.
Explanation: Where selects the rows on a particular condition. From gives the relation which involves the operation.

Questions: The query given below will not give an error. Which one of the following has to be replaced to get the desired output?  SELECT ID, name, dept name, salary * 1.1     WHERE instructor;
Explanation: Where selects the rows on a particular condition. From gives the relation which involves the operation. Since Instructor is a relation it has to have from clause.

Questions: The ________ clause is used to list the attributes desired in the result of a query.
Explanation: None

Questions: This Query can be replaced by which one of the following?      SELECT name, course_id          FROM instructor, teachesv      WHERE instructor_ID= teaches_ID;
A: Select name,course_id from teaches,instructor where instructor_id=course_id;
B: Select name, course_id from instructor natural join teaches;
D: Select course_id from instructor join teaches;
Explanation: Join clause joins two tables by matching the common column.

Questions: SELECT * FROM employee WHERE salary>10000 AND dept_id=101; Which of the following fields are displayed as output?
D: All the field of employee relation
Explanation: Here * is used to select all the fields of the relation.

Questions: Which of the following statements contains an error?
B: Select empid from emp where empid = 10006;
D: Select empid where empid = 1009 and lastname = ‘GELLER’;
Explanation: This query do not have from clause which specifies the relation from which the values has to be selected.

Questions: In the given query which of the keyword has to be inserted?  INSERT INTO employee _____ (1002,Joey,2000);
Explanation: Value keyword has to be used to insert the values into the table.
As keyword is used to rename.

Questions: SELECT * FROM employee WHERE dept_name="Comp Sci";  In the SQL given above there is an error . Identify the error.
Explanation: For any string operations single quoted(‘) must be used to enclose.

Questions: SELECT emp_name  FROM department  WHERE dept_name LIKE ’ _____ Computer Science’;  Which one of the following has to be added into the blank to select the dept_name which has Computer Science as its ending string?
Explanation: The % character matches any substring.

Questions: _ _ _ ’ matches any string of ______ three characters. ’_ _ _ %’ matches any string of at ______ three characters.
Explanation: None.

Questions: SELECT * FROM instructor  ORDER BY salary ____, name ___;  To display the salary from greater to smaller and name in ascending order which of the following options should be used?
Explanation: None.

Questions: SELECT name  FROM instructor  WHERE salary <= 100000 AND salary >= 90000;  This query can be replaced by which of the following ?
A: SELECT name  FROM instructor WHERE salary BETWEEN 90000 AND 100000;
B: SELECT name FROM employee  WHERE salary <= 90000 AND salary>=100000;
C: SELECT name FROM employee  WHERE salary BETWEEN 90000 AND 100000;
D: SELECT name FROM instructor WHERE salary BETWEEN 100000 AND 90000;
Explanation: SQL includes a between comparison operator to simplify where clauses that specify that a value be less than or equal to some value and greater than or equal to some other value.

Questions: In SQL the spaces at the end of the string are removed by _______ function.
Explanation: The syntax of trim is Trim(s); where s-string.

Questions: _____ operator is used for appending two strings.
Explanation: || is the concatenation operator.

Questions: The union operation is represented by
Explanation: Union operator combines the relations.

Questions: The intersection operator is used to get the _____ tuples.
Explanation: Intersection operator ignores unique tuples and takes only common ones.

Questions: The union operation automatically __________ unlike the select clause.
Explanation: None.

Questions: If we want to retain all duplicates, we must write ________ in place of union.
Explanation: Union all will combine all the tuples including duplicates.

Questions: For like predicate which of the following is true.  i) % matches zero OF more characters. ii) _ matches exactly one CHARACTER.
Explanation: % is used with like and _ is used to fill in the character.

Questions: The number of attributes in relation is called as its
Explanation: None.

Questions: ____ clause is an additional filter that is applied to the result.
Explanation: Having is used to provide additional aggregate filtration to the query.

Questions: ________ joins are SQL server default
Explanation: It is optional to give the inner keyword with the join as it is default.

Questions: The _____________ is essentially used to search for patterns in target string.
Explanation: Like predicate matches the string in the given pattern.

Questions: A _____ indicates an absent value that may exist but be unknown or that may not exist at all.
Explanation: None.

Questions: If the attribute phone number is included in the relation all the values need not be entered into the phone number column. This type of entry is given as
Explanation: Null is used to represent the absence of a value.

Questions: The predicate in a where clause can involve Boolean operations such as and. The result of true and unknown is_______ false and unknown is _____ while unknown and unknown is _____
Explanation: None.

Questions: In an employee table to include the attributes whose value always have some value which of the following constraint must be used?
Explanation: Not null constraint removes the tuples of null values.

Questions: Using the ______ clause retains only one copy of such identical tuples.
Explanation: Not null

Questions:
The primary key must be
a
Explanation: Primary key must satisfy unique and not null condition for sure.

Questions: You attempt to query the database with this command:  SELECT nvl (100 / quantity, NONE)       FROM inventory; Why does this statement cause an error when QUANTITY values are null?
A: The expression attempts to divide by a null value
B: The data types in the conversion function are incompatible
C: The character string none should be enclosed in single quotes (‘ ‘)
D: A null value used in an expression cannot be converted to an actual value
Explanation: The expression attempts to divide by a null value is erroneous in sql.

Questions: The result of _____unknown is unknown.
Explanation: Since unknown does not hold any value the value cannot have a reverse value.

Questions: Aggregate functions are functions that take a ___________ as input and return a single value.
D: Both Collection of values & Single value
Explanation: None.

Questions: SELECT __________ FROM instructor  WHERE dept name= ’Comp. Sci.’; Which of the following should be used to find the mean of the salary ?
Explanation: Avg() is used to find the mean of the values.

Questions: SELECT COUNT (____ ID)  FROM teaches WHERE semester = ’Spring’ AND YEAR = 2010;     If we do want to eliminate duplicates, we use the keyword ______in the aggregate expression.
Explanation: Distinct keyword is used to select only unique items from the relation.

Questions: All aggregate functions except _____ ignore null values in their input collection.
Explanation: * is used to select all values including null.

Questions: A Boolean data type that can take values true, false, and________
Explanation: Unknown values do not take null value but it is not known.

Questions: The ____ connective tests for set membership, where the set is a collection of values produced by a select clause. The ____ connective tests for the absence of set membership.
Explanation: In checks, if the query has the value but not in checks if it does not have the value.

Questions: The phrase “greater than at least one” is represented in SQL by _____
Explanation: >some takes atlest one value above it .

Questions: We can test for the nonexistence of tuples in a subquery by using the _____ construct.
Explanation: Exists is used to check for the existence of tuples.

Questions: SELECT dept_name, ID, avg (salary)FROM instructor GROUP BY dept_name; This statement IS erroneous because
B: Dept_id should not be used in group by clause
D: Group by clause is not valid in this query
Explanation: Any attribute that is not present in the group by clause must appear only inside an aggregate function if it appears in the select clause, otherwise the query is treated as erroneous.

Questions: SQL applies predicates in the _______ clause after groups have been formed, so aggregate functions may be used.
Explanation: The with clause provides away of defining a temporary relation whose definition is available only to the query in which the with clause occurs.

Questions: Aggregate functions can be used in the select list or the_______clause of a select statement or subquery. They cannot be used in a ______ clause.
Explanation: To include aggregate functions having clause must be included after where.

Questions: The ________ keyword is used to access attributes of preceding tables or subqueries in the from clause.
Explanation:
Eg : SELECT name, salary, avg salary FROM instructor I1, lateral (SELECT avg(salary) AS avg salary     FROM instructor I2   WHERE I2.dept name= I1.dept name); Without the lateral clause, the subquery cannot access the correlation variable
I1 from the outer query.

Questions: Which of the following creates a temporary relation for the query on which it is defined?
Explanation: The with clause provides a way of defining a temporary relation whose definition is available only to the query in which the with clause occurs.

Questions: Subqueries cannot:
A: Use group by or group functions
B: Retrieve data from a table different from the one in the outer query
D: Appear in select, update, delete, insert statements.
Explanation: None.

Questions: Which of the following is not an aggregate function?
Explanation: With is used to create temporary relation and its not an aggregate function.

Questions: The EXISTS keyword will be true if:
A: Any row in the subquery meets the condition only
B: All rows in the subquery fail the condition only
C: Both of these two conditions are met
D: Neither of these two conditions is met
Explanation: EXISTS keyword checks for existance of a condition.

Questions: How can you find rows that do not match some specified condition?
Explanation: None of the mentioned

Questions: A Delete command operates on ______ relation.
Explanation: Delete can delete from only one table at a time.

Questions: Delete from r where P;  The above command
A: Deletes a particular tuple from the relation
C: Clears all entries from the relation
Explanation: Here P gives the condition for deleting specific rows.

Questions: Which one of the following deletes all the entries but keeps the structure of the relation.
B: Delete from instructor where dept name= ’Finance’;
C: Delete from instructor where salary between 13000 and 15000;
Explanation: Absence of condition deletes all rows.

Questions: UPDATE instructor  ____ salary= salary * 1.05; Fill in with correct keyword to update the instructor relation.
Explanation: Set is used to update the particular value.

Questions: _______ are useful in SQL update statements, where they can be used in the set clause.
Explanation: None.

Questions: The problem of ordering the update in multiple updates is avoided using
Explanation: The case statements can add the order of updating tuples.

Questions: The____condition allows a general predicate over the relations being joined.
Explanation: On gives the condition for the join expression.

Questions: Which of the join operations do not preserve non matched tuples?
Explanation: INNER JOIN: Returns all rows when there is at least one match in BOTH tables.

Questions: What type of join is needed when you wish to include rows that do not have matching values?
Explanation: An outer join does not require each record in the two joined tables to have a matching record..

Questions: How many tables may be included with a join?
Explanation: Join can combine multiple tables.

Questions: Which are the join types in join condition:
Explanation: There are totally four join types in SQL.

Questions: How many join types in join condition:
Explanation: Types are inner join, left outer join, right outer join, full join, cross join.

Questions: Which join refers to join records from the right table that have no matching key in the left table are include in the result set:
Explanation: RIGHT OUTER JOIN: Return all rows from the right table and the matched rows from the left table.

Questions: The operation which is not considered a basic operation of relational algebra is
Explanation: None.

Questions: In SQL the statement select * from R, S is equivalent to
A: Select * from R natural join S
B: Select * from R cross join S
C: Select * from R union join S
D: Select * from R inner join S
Explanation: None.

Questions: Which of the following creates a virtual relation for storing the query?
Explanation: Any such relation that is not part of the logical model, but is made visible to a user as a virtual relation, is called a view.

Questions: Which of the following is the syntax for views where v is view name?
Explanation: <query expression> is any legal query expression. The view name is represented by v.

Questions: Materialised views make sure that
C: View definition is verified for error
D: View is deleted after specified time
Explanation: None.

Questions: Updating the value of the view
A: Will affect the relation from which it is defined
B: Will not change the view definition
C: Will not affect the relation from which it is defined
Explanation: Cannot determine

Questions: SQL view is said to be updatable (that is, inserts, updates or deletes can be applied on the view) if which of the following conditions are satisfied by the query defining the view?
A: The from clause has only one database relation
B: The query does not have a group by or having clause
C: The select clause contains only attribute names of the relation and does not have any expressions, aggregates, or distinct specification
Explanation: All of the conditions must be satisfied to update the view in sql.

Questions: Which of the following is used at the end of the view to reject the tuples which do not satisfy the condition in where clause?
Explanation: Views can be defined with a with check option clause at the end of the view definition; then, if a tuple inserted into the view does not satisfy the view’s where clause condition, the insertion is rejected by the database system.

Questions: A _________ consists of a sequence of query and/or update statements.
Explanation: Transaction is a set of operation until commit.

Questions: Which of the following makes the transaction permanent in the database?
Explanation: Commit work commits the current transaction.

Questions: In order to undo the work of transaction after last commit which one should be used?
Explanation: Rollback work causes the current transaction to be rolled back; that is, it undoes all the updates performed by the SQL statements in the transaction.

Questions: In case of any shut down during transaction before commit which of the following statement is done automatically?
Explanation: Once a transaction has executed commit work, its effects can no longer be undone by rollback work.

Questions: In order to maintain the consistency during transactions, database provides
Explanation: By atomic, either all the effects of the transaction are reflected in the database, or none are (after rollback).

Questions: Transaction processing is associated with everything below except
A: Conforming an action or triggering a response
B: Producing detail summary or exception report
Explanation: None.

Questions: A transaction completes its execution is said to be
Explanation: A complete transaction always commits.

Questions: Which of the following is used to get back all the transactions back after rollback?
Explanation: None.

Questions: ______ will undo all statements up to commit?
Explanation: Flashback will undo all the statements and Abort will terminate the operation.

Questions: To include integrity constraint in an existing relation use :
Explanation: SYNTAX – alter table table-name add constraint, where constraint can be any constraint on the relation.

Questions: Which of the following is not an integrity constraint?
Explanation: Positive is a value and not a constraint.

Questions: CREATE TABLE Manager(ID NUMERIC,Name VARCHAR(20),budget NUMERIC,Details VARCHAR(30)); Inorder to ensure that the value of budget is non-negative which of the following should be used?
Explanation: A common use of the check clause is to ensure that attribute values satisfy specified conditions, in effect creating a powerful type system.

Questions: Foreign key is the one in which the ________ of one relation is referenced in another relation.
Explanation: The foreign-key declaration specifies that for each course tuple, the department name specified in the tuple must exist in the department relation.

Questions: Domain constraints, functional dependency and referential integrity are special forms of _________
Explanation: An assertion is a predicate expressing a condition we wish the database to always satisfy.

Questions: Which of the following is the right syntax for the assertion?
Explanation: None.

Questions: Data integrity constraints are used to:
A: Control who is allowed access to the data
B: Ensure that duplicate records are not entered into the table
C: Improve the quality of data entered for a specific property (i.e., table column)
D: Prevent users from changing the values stored in the table
Explanation: None.

Questions: Which of the following can be addressed by enforcing a referential integrity constraint?
A: All phone numbers must include the area code
B: Certain fields are required (such as the email address, or phone number) before the record is accepted
C: Information on the customer must be known before anything can be sold to that customer
D: When entering an order quantity, the user must input a number and not some text (i.e., 12 rather than ‘a dozen’)
Explanation: The information can be referred to and obtained.

Questions: Dates must be specified in the format
Explanation: yyyy/mm/dd is the default format in sql.

Questions: A ________ on an attribute of a relation is a data structure that allows the database system to find those tuples in the relation that have a specified value for that attribute efficiently, without scanning through all the tuples of the relation.
Explanation: Index is the reference to the tuples in a relation.

Questions: Which of the following is used to store movie and image files?
Explanation: SQL therefore provides large-object data types for character data (clob) and binary data (blob). The letters “lob” in these data types stand for “Large OBject”.

Questions: The user defined data type can be created using
Explanation: The create type clause can be used to define new types.Syntax : create type Dollars as numeric(12,2) final; .

Questions: Values of one type can be converted to another domain using which of the following?
Explanation: Example of cast :cast (department.budget to numeric(12,2)). SQL provides drop type and alter type clauses to drop or modify types that have been created earlier.

Questions: Which of the following closely resembles Create view?
Explanation: The ‘create table . . . as’ statement closely resembles the create view statement and both are defined by using queries. The main difference is that the contents of the table are set when the table is created, whereas the contents of a view always reflect the current query result.

Questions: In contemporary databases, the top level of the hierarchy consists of ______ each of which can contain _____
Explanation: None.

Questions: Which of the following statements creates a new table temp instructor that has the same schema as an instructor.
Explanation: None.

Questions: The database administrator who authorizes all the new users, modifies the database and takes grants privilege is
Explanation: The authorizations provided by the administrator to the user is a privilege.

Questions: Which of the following is used to provide privilege to only a particular attribute?
A: Grant select on employee to Amit
B: Grant update(budget) on department to Raj
C: Grant update(budget,salary,Rate) on department to Raj
Explanation: This grant statement gives user Raj update authorization on the budget attribute of the department relation.

Questions: Which of the following statement is used to remove the privilege from the user Amir?
A: Remove update on department from Amir
B: Revoke update on employee from Amir
C: Delete select on department from Raj
D: Grant update on employee from Amir
Explanation: revoke on from ;

Questions: Which of the following is true regarding views?
A: The user who creates a view cannot be given update authorization on a view without having update authorization on the relations used to define the view
B: The user who creates a view cannot be given update authorization on a view without having update authorization on the relations used to define the view
C: If a user creates a view on which no authorization can be granted, the system will allow the view creation request
D: A user who creates a view receives all privileges on that view
Explanation: A user who creates a view receives all privileges on that view

Questions: If we wish to grant a privilege and to allow the recipient to pass the privilege on to other users, we append the __________ clause to the appropriate grant command.
Explanation: None.

Questions: In authorization graph, if DBA provides authorization to u1 which inturn gives to u2 which of the following is correct?
A: If DBA revokes authorization from u1 then u2 authorization is also revoked
B: If u1 revokes authorization from u2 then u2 authorization is revoked
C: If DBA & u1 revokes authorization from u1 then u2 authorization is also revoked
D: If u2 revokes authorization then u1 authorization is revoked
Explanation: A user has an authorization if and only if there is a path from the root of the authorization graph down to the node representing the user.

Questions: Which of the following is used to avoid cascading of authorizations from the user?
B: Revoke select on department from Amit, Satoshi restrict;
C: Revoke grant option for select on department from Amit;
D: Revoke select on department from Amit, Satoshi cascade
Explanation: The revoke statement may specify restrict in order to prevent cascading revocation. The keyword cascade can be used instead of restrict to indicate that revocation should cascade.

Questions: The granting and revoking of roles by the user may cause some confusions when that user role is revoked. To overcome the above situation
A: The privilege must be granted only by roles
B: The privilege is granted by roles and users
C: The user role cannot be removed once given
D: By restricting the user access to the roles
Explanation: The current role associated with a session can be set by executing set role name. The specified role must have been granted to the user, else the set role statement fails.

Questions: Which of the following is used to access the database server at the time of executing the program and get the data from the server accordingly?
Explanation: Embedded SQL, the SQL statements are identified at compile time using a preprocessor. The preprocessor submits the SQL statements to the database system for precompilation and optimization; then it replaces the SQL statements in the application program with appropriate code and function calls before invoking the programming-language compiler.

Questions: Which of the following header must be included in java program to establish database connectivity using JDBC ?
Explanation: The Java program must import java.sql.*, which contains the interface definitions for the functionality provided by JDBC.

Questions: DriverManager.getConnection(_______ , ______ , ______)What are the two parameters that are included?
A: URL or machine name where server runs, Password, User ID
B: URL or machine name where server runs, User ID, Password
C: User ID, Password, URL or machine name where server runs
D: Password, URL or machine name where server runs, User ID
Explanation: The database must be opened first in order to perform any operations for which this get connection method is used.

Questions: Which of the following invokes functions in sql?
Explanation: DBC provides a Callable Statement interface that allows invocation of SQL stored procedures and functions.

Questions: Which of the following function is used to find the column count of the particular resultset?
Explanation: The interface ResultSet has a method, getMetaData(), that returns a ResultSetMetaData object that contains metadata about the result set. ResultSetMetaData, in turn, has methods to find metadata information, such as the number of columns in the result, the name of a specified column, or the type of a specified column.

Questions: Which of the following is a following statement is a prepared statements?
D: ) EXEC SQL <embedded SQL statement > END EXEC;
Explanation: is used as a placeholder whose value can be provided later.

Questions: Which of the following is used as the embedded SQL in COBOL?
D: ) EXEC SQL <embedded SQL statement > END EXEC;
Explanation: EXEC SQL <embedded SQL statement >; is normally in C.

Questions: Which of the following is used to access large objects from a database ?
Explanation: None.

Questions: Which of the following is used to access the database server at the time of executing the program and get the data from the server accordingly?
Explanation: Embedded SQL, the SQL statements are identified at compile time using a preprocessor. The preprocessor submits the SQL statements to the database system for precompilation and optimization; then it replaces the SQL statements in the application program with appropriate code and function calls before invoking the programming-language compiler.

Questions: Which of the following header must be included in java program to establish database connectivity using JDBC ?

Questions: Assymmetric Encryption: Why can a message encrypted with the Public Key only be decrypted with the receiver’s appropriate Private Key?
A: Not true, the message can also be decrypted with the Public Key
B: A so called “one way function with back door” is applied for the encryption
C: The Public Key contains a special function which is used to encrypt the message and which can only be reversed by the appropriate Private Key
D: The encrypted message contains the function for decryption which identifies the Private Key
Explanation: An one-way function is a function which a computer can calculate quickly, but whose reversal would last months or years. An one-way function with back door can be reversed with the help of a couple of additional information (the back door), but scarcely without this information. The information for the back door is contained in the private Key.

Questions: Which is the largest disadvantage of symmetric Encrypti
A: More complex and therefore more time-consuming calculations
B: Problem of the secure transmission of the Secret Key
Explanation: As there is only one key in the symmetrical encryption, this must be known by both sender and recipient and this key is sufficient to decrypt the secret message. Therefore it must be exchanged between sender and receiver in such a manner that an unauthorized person can in no case take possession of it.

Questions: Which is the principle of the encryption using a key?
A: The key indicates which function is used for encryption. Thereby it is more difficult to decrypt an intercepted message as the function is unknown
B: The key contains the secret function for encryption including parameters. Only a password can activate the key
C: All functions are public, only the key is secret. It contains the parameters used for the encryption resp. decryption
D: The key prevents the user of having to reinstall the software at each change in technology or in the functions for encryption
Explanation: The encoding of a message is calculated by an algorithm. If always the same algorithm would be used, it would be easy to crack intercepted messages. However, it isn’t possible to invent a new algorithm whenever the old one was cracked, therefore the possibility to parameterize algorithms is needed and this is the assignment of the key.

Questions: The relation EMPDT1 is defined with attributes empcode(unique), name, street, city, state, and pincode. For any pincode, there is only one city and state. Also, for any given street, city and state, there is just one pincode. In normalization terms EMPDT1 is a relation in
D: BCNF and hence also in 3NF, 2NF and 1NF
Explanation:
Empcode is unique, therefore it is the primary key. Since the primary key consists of a single attribute there will be no partial dependency, hence the relation is in 2NF.
From the question we get the FDs as below:
pincode -> city, state
street,city,state -> pincode
From the FDs we can see that there are transitive dependencies, hence the table is not in 3NF.

Questions: Which one of the following statements is FALSE?
A: Any relation with two attributes is in BCNF
B: A relation in which every key has only one attribute is in 2NF
C: A prime attribute can be transitively dependent on a key in a 3 NF relation
D: A prime attribute can be transitively dependent on a key in a BCNF relation
Explanation:
A table is in 3NF if and only if, for each of its functional dependencies X -> A, at least one of the following conditions holds:
* X contains A (that is, X -> A is trivial functional dependency), or
* X is a superkey, or
* A should be prime attribute.

Explanation: The wound–wait scheme is a preemptive technique. It is a counterpart to the wait–die scheme.

Explanation: Well-designed systems have numerous internal checks, at the hardware and the software level, that bring the system to a halt when there is an error. Hence, the fail-stop assumption is a reasonable one.

Questions: Which kind of failure loses its data in head crash or failure during a transfer operation.
Explanation: Copies of the data on other disks, or archival backups on tertiary media, such as DVD or tapes, are used to recover from the failure.

Questions: The failure occurred sufficiently early during the transfer that the destination block remains intact.
Explanation: Copies of the data on other disks, or archival backups on tertiary media, such as DVD or tapes, are used to recover from the failure.

Questions: The database is partitioned into fixed-length storage units called
Explanation: Blocks are the units of data transfer to and from disk, and may contain several data items.

Questions: Which of the following causes system to crash
Explanation: The content of non-volatile storage remains intact, and is not corrupted.

Questions: The log is a sequence of _________ recording all the update activities in the database.
Explanation: The most widely used structure for recording database modifications is the log.

Questions: In the ___________ scheme, a transaction that wants to update the database first creates a complete copy of the database.
Explanation: If at any point the transaction has to be aborted, the system merely deletes the new copy. The old copy of the database has not been affected.

Questions: The ____________ scheme uses a page table containing pointers to all pages; the page table itself and all updated pages are copied to a new location.
Explanation: Any page which is not updated by a transaction is not copied, but instead the new page table just stores a pointer to the original page.

Questions: The current copy of the database is identified by a pointer, called ____________ which is stored on disk.
Explanation: Any page which is not updated by a transaction is not copied, but instead the new page table just stores a pointer to the original page.

Questions: If a transaction does not modify the database until it has committed, it is said to use the ___________ technique.
Explanation: Deferred modification has the overhead that transactions need to make local copies of all updated data items; further, if a transaction reads a data item that it has updated, it must read the value from its local copy.

Questions: If database modifications occur while the transaction is still active, the transaction is said to use the ___________technique.
Explanation: We say a transaction modifies the database if it performs an update on a disk buffer, or on the disk itself; updates to the private part of main memory do not count as database modifications.

Questions: _______ using a log record sets the data item specified in the log record to the old value.
Explanation: Undo brings the previous contents.

Questions: In the __________ phase, the system replays updates of all transactions by scanning the log forward from the last checkpoint.
Explanation: Undo brings the previous contents.

Questions: The actions which are played in the order while recording it is called ______________ history.
Explanation: Undo brings the previous contents.

Questions: A special redo-only log record < Ti, Xj, V1> is written to the log, where V1 is the value being restored to data item Xj during the rollback. These log records are sometimes called
Explanation: Such records do not need undo information since we never need to undo such an undo operation.

Questions: In order to reduce the overhead in retrieving the records from the storage space we use
Explanation: The output to stable storage is in units of blocks.

Questions: The order of log records in the stable storage ____________ as the order in which they were written to the log buffer.
Explanation: As a result of log buffering, a log record may reside in only main memory (volatile storage) for a considerable time before it is output to stable storage.

Questions: Before a block of data in main memory can be output to the database, all log records pertaining to data in that block must have been output to stable storage. This is
Explanation: The WAL rule requires only that the undo information in the log has been output to stable storage, and it permits the redo information to be written later.

Questions: Writing the buffered log to __________ is sometimes referred to as a log force.
Explanation: If there are insufficient log records to fill the block, all log records in main memory are combined into a partially full block and are output to stable storage.

Questions: The _______________ policy, allows a transaction to commit even if it has modified some blocks that have not yet been written back to disk.
Explanation: No-force policy allows faster commit of transactions.

Questions: ______ policy allows multiple updates to accumulate on a block before it is output to stable storage, which can reduce the number of output operations greatly for frequently updated blocks.
Explanation: No-force policy allows faster commit of transactions.

Questions: The ___________ policy, allows the system to write modified blocks to disk even if the transactions that made those modifications have not all committed.
Explanation: The no-steal policy does not work with transactions that perform a large number of updates.

Questions: Locks on buffer blocks are unrelated to locks used for concurrency-control of transactions, and releasing them in a non-two-phase manner does not have any implications on transaction serializability. This is
Explanation: These locks, and other similar locks that are held for a short duration.

Questions: The __________________ contains a list of blocks that have been updated in the database buffer.
Explanation: Dirty blocks are those that have been updated in memory, and the disk version is not up-to-date.

Questions: The operating system reserves space on disk for storing virtual-memory pages that are not currently in main memory; this space is called
Explanation: Almost all current-generation operating systems retain complete control of virtual memory.

Questions: The silicon chips used for data processing are called
Explanation: PROM is Programmable Read Only Memory.

Questions: Which of the following is used for manufacturing chips?
Explanation: A semiconductor is a material which has electrical conductivity between that of a conductor such as copper and that of an insulator such as glass.

Questions: What was the name of the first commercially available microprocessor chip?
Explanation: The Intel 4004 is a 4-bit central processing unit (CPU) released by Intel Corporation in 1971

Questions: The magnetic storage chip used to provide non-volatile direct access storage of data and that have no moving parts are known as
Explanation: Bubble domain visualization by using CMOS-MagView.

Questions: The ALU of a computer normally contains a number of high speed storage element called
Explanation: External control unit tells the ALU what operation to perform on that data, and then the ALU stores its result into an output register.

Questions: Which of the following is used only for data entry and storage, and never for processing?
Explanation: Dumb terminals are those that can interpret a limited number of control codes.

Questions: Non-volatile storage needs to have a _________ where the loses in future can be recovered.
Explanation: The basic scheme is to dump the entire contents of the database to stable storage periodically—say, once per day.

Questions: A dump of the database contents is also referred to as an _____________ dump.
Explanation: We can archive the dumps and use them later to examine old states of the database.

Questions: ________ dump, writes out SQL DDL statements and SQL insert statements to a file, which can then be reexecuted to re-create the database.
Explanation: Such dumps are useful when migrating data to a different instance of the database, or to a different version of the database software, since the physical locations and layout may be different in the other database instance or database software version.

Questions: _____ dump schemes have been developed that allow transactions to be active while the dump is in progress.
Explanation: The simple dump procedure described here is costly and so fuzzy dump is used.

Questions: ARIES uses a ___________ to identify log records, and stores it in database pages.
Explanation: LSN is used to identify which operations have been applied to a database page.

Questions: ARIES supports ___________ operations, which are physical in that the affected page is physically identified, but can be logical within the page.
Explanation: The deletion of a record from a page may result in many other records in the page being shifted, if a slotted page structure is used.

Questions: ____________ is used to minimize unnecessary redos during recovery.
Explanation: Dirty pages are those that have been updated in memory, and the disk version is not up-to-date

Questions: ______ scheme that records only information about dirty pages and associated information and does not even require of writing dirty pages to disk.
Explanation: It flushes dirty pages in the background, continuously, instead of writing them during checkpoints.

Questions: Whenever an update operation occurs on a page, the operation stores the LSN of its log record in the _______ field of the page.
Explanation: Each page maintains an identifier called the PageLSN.

Questions: There are special redo-only log records generated during transaction rollback, called _________ in ARIES.
Explanation: These serve the same purpose as the redo-only log records in our earlier recovery scheme.

Questions: The __________________ contains a list of pages that have been updated in the database buffer.
Explanation: Dirty pages are those that have been updated in memory, and the disk version is not up-to-date.

Questions: _______ determines which transactions to undo, which pages were dirty at the time of the crash, and the LSN from which the redo pass should start.
Explanation: The analysis pass finds the last complete checkpoint log record, and reads in the DirtyPageTable from this record.

Questions: ____ starts from a position determined during analysis, and performs a redo, repeating history, to bring the database to a state it was in before the crash.
Explanation: The redo pass repeats history by replaying every action that is not already reflected in the page on disk.

Questions: _________ rolls back all transactions that were incomplete at the time of crash.
Explanation: It performs a single backward scan of the log, undoing all transactions in undo-list.

Questions: Which lock should be obtained to prevent a concurrent transaction from executing a conflicting read, insert or delete operation on the same key value.
Explanation: Operations acquire lower-level locks while they execute, but release them when they complete; the corresponding transaction must however retain a higher-level lock in a two-phase manner to prevent concurrent transactions from executing conflicting actions.
